translated: one-pointed concentration, bad wisdom, the possession of wisdom, the mind of an ordinary person, the definite wrong, the definite right, the definite vehicle of the Å›rÄvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg par nges pa dang / theg pa chen por nges pa'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg par nges pa dang / theg pa chen por nges pa'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: the definite vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas, and the definite vehicle of the MahÄyÄna.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //ğŸ”½'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba /
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering.ğŸ”½This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa /
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //ğŸ”½de mi skye ba shes pa'i sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // de mi skye ba shes pa'i sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.ğŸ”½â€œHe knows the noble truth of suffering as it really is through the knowledge of non-arising.

original: shin tu kun tu mi rgyu ba'i shes pa'i kun 'byung ba rab tu shes so //ğŸ”½chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa shin tu skad cig pa /
analyzed: shin tu kun tu mi rgyu ba'i shes pa'i kun 'byung ba rab tu shes so // chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa shin tu skad cig pa /
translated: He knows the origin of suffering through the knowledge of complete non-occurrence.

original: 'gog pa shes pas 'gog par rab tu shes so //ğŸ”½thams cad kyi rjes su song ba nam mkha' yang @461b dag par 'du ba bdag gi ba med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pas 'gog par rab tu shes so // thams cad kyi rjes su song ba nam mkha' yang @461b dag par 'du ba bdag gi ba med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
translated: He knows cessation through the knowledge of cessation, which is neither annihilation nor eternalism, which is momentary,ğŸ”½and which is the knowledge of the path that goes to cessation.ğŸ”½He knows the path through the knowledge of the path that goes everywhere, that is pure like space, that is without â€˜mineâ€™ and grasping,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i shes pas lam rab tu shes so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i shes pas lam rab tu shes so //
translated: and that is completely pure.

original: de 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir mngon sum du'ang mi byed la bden pa yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa dang /
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir mngon sum du'ang mi byed la bden pa yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa dang /
translated: Although they know the four noble truths in this way, just as they are, they do not actualize them in order to ripen beings.

original: bsgoms pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: bsgoms pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: They teach the Dharma to beings in order to fully understand, abandon,ğŸ”½meditate on, and actualize the truths.

original: de'i chos bstan pa de bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa yin /
analyzed: de'i chos bstan pa de bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa yin /
translated: Their teaching of the Dharma accords with the truth.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang 'gal ba med pa yin /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang 'gal ba med pa yin /
translated: It is not in conflict with dependent origination.

original: mthar lta ba thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin /
analyzed: mthar lta ba thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin /
translated: It is the complete abandonment of all extreme views.

original: dbu ma'i lam la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam la zhugs pa yin /
translated: It is the entry into the middle way.

original: rten pa'i chos mngon sum du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rten pa'i chos mngon sum du gyur pa yin te /
translated: It is the direct realization of the Dharma that is relied upon.

original: de chos thams cad rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas pa'i kha na las kyi /
analyzed: de chos thams cad rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas pa'i kha na las kyi /
translated: It is the teaching that all phenomena have causes and conditions.

original: bdag gi kha na las pa ma yin /
analyzed: bdag gi kha na las pa ma yin /
translated: It is not a misdeed of the self.

original: sems can gyi kha na las pa ma yin /
analyzed: sems can gyi kha na las pa ma yin /
translated: It is not a misdeed of sentient beings.

original: srog gi kha na las pa ma yin /
analyzed: srog gi kha na las pa ma yin /
translated: It is not a misdeed of a life force.

original: gso ba'i kha na las pa ma yin /ğŸ”½skyes bu'i kha na las pa ma yin /
analyzed: gso ba'i kha na las pa ma yin / skyes bu'i kha na las pa ma yin /
translated: It is not a transgression against the gods.ğŸ”½It is not a transgression against humans.

original: gang zag gi kha na las pa ma yin par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang zag gi kha na las pa ma yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: It is not a transgression against individuals.

original: de ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams su rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams su rab tu shes so //
translated: â€œHe understands that the condition of ignorance produces formations.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang / gzugs dang / ming dang / gzugs @462a *//
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang / gzugs dang / ming dang / gzugs @462a *//
translated: He understands that the condition of formations produces consciousness, that the condition of consciousness produces name and form, and that the condition of name and form produces the six sense sources.

original: kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug dang / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa dang /
analyzed: kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug dang / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa dang /
translated: He understands that the condition of the six sense sources produces contact, that the condition of contact produces sensation, that the condition of sensation produces craving, that the condition of craving produces grasping, that the condition of grasping produces the process of becoming,

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: grief, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po ma 'dres pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po ma 'dres pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur bar rab tu shes so //
translated: Thus, one should know that this great mass of pure suffering comes into being.

original: de ma rig pa 'gag pa nas rga shi 'gag pa'i bar dang / de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po ma 'dres pa 'di 'gag par 'gyur bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ma rig pa 'gag pa nas rga shi 'gag pa'i bar dang / de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po ma 'dres pa 'di 'gag par 'gyur bar rab tu shes so //
translated: When ignorance ceases, there is the cessation of formations, and so on, up to the cessation of the great mass of pure suffering.

original: de 'di la yang dag par slob pa na gang ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba de ni bdag gi rkyen las byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: de 'di la yang dag par slob pa na gang ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba de ni bdag gi rkyen las byung ba ma yin /
translated: When one trains in this, one should know that what arises due to the condition of ignorance does not arise due to the condition of a self.

original: sems can gyi rkyen las byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: sems can gyi rkyen las byung ba ma yin /
translated: It does not arise due to the condition of a sentient being,

original: srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag gi rkyen las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag gi rkyen las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: a living being, a nourished being, or a person.

original: gang bdag gi rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa nas /
analyzed: gang bdag gi rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa nas /
translated: What does not arise due to the condition of a self

original: gang zag gi rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa'i bar de ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa'i bar de ni stong pa'o //
translated: That which is not produced by the conditions of a person is empty.

original: stong pa gang yin pa de ni chad pa ma yin /
analyzed: stong pa gang yin pa de ni chad pa ma yin /
translated: That which is empty is not annihilated.

original: rtag pa ma yin //
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin //
translated: It is not permanent.

original: chad pa ma yin /
analyzed: chad pa ma yin /
translated: It is not annihilated.ğŸ”½It is not permanent.

original: rtag pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni gdod ma nyid nas ma skyes ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni gdod ma nyid nas ma skyes ma byung ba'o //
translated: That which is not annihilated and not permanent is from the very beginning unborn and unoriginated.

original: gdod ma @462b nyid nas ma skyes ma byung ba gang yin pa de ni dus gsum du brjod du med do //
analyzed: gdod ma @462b nyid nas ma skyes ma byung ba gang yin pa de ni dus gsum du brjod du med do //
translated: That which is from the very beginning unborn and unoriginated is inexpressible in the three times.

original: dus gsum brjod du med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dus gsum brjod du med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: That which is inexpressible in the three times is the nature of non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de bgrang ba med cing bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de bgrang ba med cing bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: That which is the nature of non-entity is beyond enumeration and transcends enumeration.

original: bgrang ba med cing bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: bgrang ba med cing bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'o //
translated: That which is beyond enumeration and transcends enumeration is the ultimate.

original: don dam pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yang dag pa'o //
translated: That which is the ultimate is the true word of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' yang dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'thab pa med cing rtsod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' yang dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'thab pa med cing rtsod pa med pa'o //
translated: The authentic words of the Buddha are free from conflict and dispute.

original: 'thab pa med cing rtsod pa med pa gang yin pa de dag dge sbyong gi chos so //
analyzed: 'thab pa med cing rtsod pa med pa gang yin pa de dag dge sbyong gi chos so //
translated: That which is free from conflict and dispute is the Dharma of the ascetic.

original: dge sbyong gi chos gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin du des de ltar shes shing gnas te /ğŸ”½tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun 'byung bas ma rig pa kun 'byung bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin du des de ltar shes shing gnas te / tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun 'byung bas ma rig pa kun 'byung bar rab tu shes so //
translated: The Dharma of the ascetic is the nature of space.ğŸ”½The origin of ignorance is due to the origin of incorrect mental activity.

original: ma rig pa 'gag pa nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gag pa nas /
translated: One should understand the cessation of ignorance

original: rga shi 'gag pa'i bar du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: rga shi 'gag pa'i bar du rab tu shes te /
translated: up to the cessation of old age and death.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen tshogs pa'i shes pas chad par lta bar sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen tshogs pa'i shes pas chad par lta bar sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Through the knowledge of the assembly of causes and conditions, one should not engage in the view of annihilation.

original: bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i chos kyi rjes su song ba yin te /ğŸ”½mtha' khas mi len /ğŸ”½nye bar mi 'dzin /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i chos kyi rjes su song ba yin te / mtha' khas mi len / nye bar mi 'dzin /
translated: One should follow the Dharma of selflessness, the absence of sentient beings, the absence of life force, and the absence of personhood.ğŸ”½One should not accept the extremes.

original: mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi dmigs so //
translated: One should not grasp at them.ğŸ”½One should not observe them.

original: mtha' mi dmigs pas dbus yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //ğŸ”½chos gang la mtha' mi ndmigs pa de la dbus @463a *//
analyzed: mtha' mi dmigs pas dbus yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // chos gang la mtha' mi ndmigs pa de la dbus @463a *//
translated: Since the end is not observed, the middle is not seen.

original: yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could there be a middle in a phenomenon where the end is not observed?

original: de'i mtha' ci 'dra ba zhig snyam nas /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ci 'dra ba zhig snyam nas /
translated: Thinking, â€œWhat is the end of this like?â€

original: de mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos rnams la 'jug go /
analyzed: de mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos rnams la 'jug go /
translated: he enters into phenomena that are without end or middle.

original: chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang / dbus dang bral bas mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i chos ston pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang / dbus dang bral bas mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i chos ston pa yin no //
translated: Since the realm of phenomena is free from end and middle, he teaches the Dharma that is without end and middle.

original: de chos yang dag par blangs pa 'di dang ldan pas byang chub thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba mnyam pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de chos yang dag par blangs pa 'di dang ldan pas byang chub thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba mnyam pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Endowed with this acceptance of the Dharma, when he attains awakening, he is called the TathÄgata, the One with Unequaled Vision of the Wisdom of Liberation.

original: de la de med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la de med pa yin no //
translated: He is not on that path.

original: stobs bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin shin tu bsgoms pa dang / mtha' yas 'khyil ba'i gzungs la mkhas pas de'i rnam par grol ba ye shes mthong ba de chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang / dbus med par yang dag par 'du ba yin /
analyzed: stobs bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin shin tu bsgoms pa dang / mtha' yas 'khyil ba'i gzungs la mkhas pas de'i rnam par grol ba ye shes mthong ba de chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang / dbus med par yang dag par 'du ba yin /
translated: Through the cultivation of the samÄdhi of the array of strengths and through being skilled in the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« of infinite coils, their wisdom vision of liberation is subsumed within the realm of phenomena that is without limit or center.

original: gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa bstan pa rnams la nam mkha'i dbyings ltar rgya che zhing rnam par mi rtog la lhun gyis grub pa yin /
analyzed: gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa bstan pa rnams la nam mkha'i dbyings ltar rgya che zhing rnam par mi rtog la lhun gyis grub pa yin /
translated: With regard to the teachings on what is possible and impossible, it is vast like the realm of space, nonconceptual, and spontaneous.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa shes pa bstan pa rnam par smin pa chud mi za bar ston pa yin /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa shes pa bstan pa rnam par smin pa chud mi za bar ston pa yin /
translated: With regard to the teachings on the knowledge of the karmic actions of the past, future, and present that are taken up, it is the teaching on the ripening of karma not being lost.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi rim pa shes pa bstan pa rnams la mngon sum du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi rim pa shes pa bstan pa rnams la mngon sum du gyur pa yin /
translated: With regard to the teachings on the knowledge of the levels of faculties and diligence of all sentient beings, it is direct.

original: khams du ma dang khams sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten bstan pa rnams la shin tu rnam par gdon mi za bar ston @463b pa yin /
analyzed: khams du ma dang khams sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten bstan pa rnams la shin tu rnam par gdon mi za bar ston @463b pa yin /
translated: They are the teachers of the world of the many elements and the various elements.

original: mos pa du ma dang / mos pa sna tshogs shes pa bstan pa rnams la mi zad par ston cing 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: mos pa du ma dang / mos pa sna tshogs shes pa bstan pa rnams la mi zad par ston cing 'jug pa yin /
translated: They are the teachers of the knowledge of the many aspirations and the various aspirations.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i lam shes pa bstan pa rnams la phyogs kyi dra ba thams cad rnam par dbye ba rgyas par byed cing phung por lung ston pa yin /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i lam shes pa bstan pa rnams la phyogs kyi dra ba thams cad rnam par dbye ba rgyas par byed cing phung por lung ston pa yin /
translated: They are the teachers of the knowledge of the path that goes everywhere. They are the teachers of the explanation of the net of all directions.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / ldang ba shes pa bstan pa rnams la chos kyi sgo bsam gyi mi khyab pa rnam par bzhag pa ston pa yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / ldang ba shes pa bstan pa rnams la chos kyi sgo bsam gyi mi khyab pa rnam par bzhag pa ston pa yin /
translated: They are the teachers of the knowledge of the absorptions, the liberations, the samÄdhis, the samÄpattis, the afflictions, the purification, and the rising up. They are the teachers of the presentation of the inconceivable Dharma doors.

original: sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran pa shes pa bstan pa rnams la sems can thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho dang / tshe dang / skye ba rab 'bring tha ma dang / thog ma'i mthar chags pa med cing sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes ston pa yin /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran pa shes pa bstan pa rnams la sems can thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho dang / tshe dang / skye ba rab 'bring tha ma dang / thog ma'i mthar chags pa med cing sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes ston pa yin /
translated: In the teachings on the knowledge of remembering past lives, they teach the knowledge of the deaths, rebirths, and lives, good, bad, and mediocre, of all beings, without beginning or end, without obstruction.

original: thogs pa med cing sgrib pa med pa'i lha'i mig shes pa bstan pa rnams la kun tu rnam par lta ba thams cad du shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i lung bstan pa ston pa yin /
analyzed: thogs pa med cing sgrib pa med pa'i lha'i mig shes pa bstan pa rnams la kun tu rnam par lta ba thams cad du shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i lung bstan pa ston pa yin /
translated: In the teachings on the knowledge of the divine eye, they teach the knowledge of the vision of all the various forms of the world.ğŸ”½In the teachings on the knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements, they teach the knowledge of the abandonment of all propensities.

original: zag pa thams cad zad pa shes pa bstan pa rnams la bag chags kyi mtshams sbyar ba ma lus par spang bar shes pa ston pa yin; mi 'jigs pa shes pa bstan pa rnams la zil gyis mi non pa ston pa yin /
analyzed: zag pa thams cad zad pa shes pa bstan pa rnams la bag chags kyi mtshams sbyar ba ma lus par spang bar shes pa ston pa yin; mi 'jigs pa shes pa bstan pa rnams la zil gyis mi non pa ston pa yin /
translated: In the teachings on the knowledge of fearlessness, they teach the knowledge of being invincible.

original: snying rje chen po'i stobs shes pa bstan pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams @464a *//
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i stobs shes pa bstan pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams @464a *//
translated: In the teachings on the knowledge of great compassion, they teach the knowledge of the performance of all the activities of the buddhas.

original: cad du tha dad du bya ba med cing sbyor ba mtshungs pa mnyam pa rgyun mi gcod pa ston pa yin /
analyzed: cad du tha dad du bya ba med cing sbyor ba mtshungs pa mnyam pa rgyun mi gcod pa ston pa yin /
translated: He shows that there is no difference in all of them, and that they are the same in their application, without interruption.

original: so so ci rigs par chos bstan pa rnams la lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par 'phrul pa ston pa yin /ğŸ”½sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed cing 'dul ba'i phyir mi zad pa'i chos kyis 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i ye shes kyi yul bstan pa rnams la zab mo dang / sna tshogs dang / snrel zhir rgyu ba dang / shes rab dang /
analyzed: so so ci rigs par chos bstan pa rnams la lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par 'phrul pa ston pa yin / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed cing 'dul ba'i phyir mi zad pa'i chos kyis 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i ye shes kyi yul bstan pa rnams la zab mo dang / sna tshogs dang / snrel zhir rgyu ba dang / shes rab dang /
translated: He shows the miraculous manifestations of spontaneous wisdom in the teachings of the Dharma that are appropriate for each individual.ğŸ”½He shows the wisdom of the profound, the various, the interwoven, wisdom,

original: thabs dang / stobs dang / rnam par 'phrul ba'i ye shes ston pa yin /
analyzed: thabs dang / stobs dang / rnam par 'phrul ba'i ye shes ston pa yin /
translated: means, power, and miraculous manifestations in the teachings on the domain of wisdom of turning the inexhaustible wheel of the Dharma in order to ripen and tame all sentient beings.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa yin te /
translated: He is not shared in common with all the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: bu mo / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bu mo / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: â€œDaughter, this is the twelfth of the thus-gone onesâ€™ unique qualities of a buddha.

original: bu mo / gzhan yang /
analyzed: bu mo / gzhan yang /
translated: â€œMoreover, daughter of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod na ye shes kyis byas pa'i las rnams byed kyi nga rgyal gyis byas pa rnams mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod na ye shes kyis byas pa'i las rnams byed kyi nga rgyal gyis byas pa rnams mi byed de /
translated: When bodhisattvas practice the bodhisattva deeds, they do the actions that are done with wisdom, not those done with pride.

translated: They are like lions, majestic through their great joy; their physical actions are meaningful, since they are preceded by gnosis; their speech is under control, since their verbal actions are preceded by gnosis; and their minds are all-seeing, since their mental actions are preceded by gnosis.

translated: They are worthy of being held, since their eloquence is swift; they are the best of acquisitions, since they are the unsurpassed field of merit; they have the best of fame; and their merit is inexhaustible, since it is as vast as the expanse of reality.

It is to be unperturbed and unflustered by never turning away from generating happiness in sentient beings through knowing the superior and inferior faculties of all sentient beings.
